JobFullDesc: Microsoft is on a mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more.  Our culture is centered on embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day.  In doing so, we create life-changing innovations that impact billions of lives around the world.  You can help us achieve our mission.We are looking for an Organizational Director who is passionate about influencing and impacting high growth and dynamic businesses.  This role will leverage your passion for talent development and culture transformation to instigate changes that allow our organization to become more nimble, more scalable and resilient.  You will operate as a consultant and collaborate partner to the Business HR team, supporting them with diagnosing organizational effectiveness issues through the collection and analysis of qualitative and quantitative data, identifying talent strategies and options to address gaps and build necessary capabilities, then crafting and executing high impact implementation plans. The Microsoft Customer and Partner Solutions group is a ~60,000 strong go-to-market organization operating in 235 locations.  As part of this team, you have the opportunity to create clarity and agility across our commercial organization and connect with the world in ways no other organization can.  ResponsibilitiesOrganization System ConsultingContracts, leads, and coaches others on the design of a cohesive intervention plan (e.g., system redesign, leadership development, strategic workforce planning) for a complex situation/initiative (i.e., involving technical or political complexity, or involving many interconnected or adaptive systems) across divisions, global regions, or business units.Builds a case for proposed plans, gains ownership/agreement for the course of action, and uses internal/external resources to achieve desired goals and outcomes.Leads dialogues with the most senior executives about needs and opportunities in organizational systems to ensure strong partnerships and the adoption of recommendations. Builds ongoing strategies to keep organization, culture, and leadership topics active with leaders throughout the year.Contracts for and provides executive coaching to enable OD interventions, drive diagnostic efforts, and improve leadership capability. Organizational DiagnosisActs as an expert in the application of rigorous diagnostic frameworks and data-based assessment techniques (qualitative and quantitative). Synthesizes information to identify insights, and frames presentation of information to make recommendations and propose Organization Development interventions. Partners with peers in other disciplines and data analytics teams to continuously improve data quality, insights, and capabilities. Addresses and corrects issues in data quality.
